name: places/ChIJf4m2mbdZwokRWbey0pYy9Ho
formattedAddress: 520 W 25th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 520 W 25th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
If you work in the music industry or find yourself needing any ear protection often, these are your answer. Jaye custom fit me and had 2 pairs delivered promptly. I don't go anywhere without them, the custom fit is everything. Better than any standard ear plug by a long shot. Highly recommend ACS to anyone looking for professional level ear plugs. Totally worth the price, they have saved my hearing ability and will continue to!

Also the fact you can change the decibel settings its a major win. I have the -18/db cuts merely for dancefloor/work settings when I want to hear the music but don't want hearing loss. ACS all day!!

originalText.text: Not sure where some of the bad reviews come from but I've had two pairs that have worked incredibly.  Didn't have an issue with getting new ones done as well, and they were willing to send out a new pair in pretty minute situations.  A must for anyone who goes to shows regularly, or even works in semi-loud environments. Filters out a lot of unnecessary noise and helps you hear better.

text.text: Not sure where some of the bad reviews come from but I've had two pairs that have worked incredibly.  Didn't have an issue with getting new ones done as well, and they were willing to send out a new pair in pretty minute situations.  A must for anyone who goes to shows regularly, or even works in semi-loud environments. Filters out a lot of unnecessary noise and helps you hear better.

originalText.text: I'm a professional musician that have been using custom earplugs for over 15years. This are the most expensive and worst plugs I ever had and had to throw them away after many times sending the plugs back and even redoing one of them . They could never get the plugs right.  I eventually gave up and went to a competitor. The plugs are not consistent in shape, as one earplugs tends to be much bigger and go deeper into the ear then the other. That is already not normal. Filters were flying out at some point during a performance, leading to hearing damage. In my opinion it is also not normal they send the earplugs without checking it in person if the plugs fit in the 1st place.  Please save your hearing and your money and do not go here. This is not normal. Bad earplugs can lead to permanent damage. A company should never be allowed to produce this kind of product with such a low quality control!

originalText.text:
I own custom in-ear monitors and acoustic ear-plugs from ACS.  All has been high quality and lasted. When I had issues with the ear-plugs they adjusted and sent me a new pair.

Possibly cheaper alternatives elsewhere but given they have a store front in nyc and do the molds for you, it's worth it in my opinion.

originalText.text:
I never post reviews but i felt i had to warn other people about a potential bad purchase.

Long story short they are very attentive and quick at the point of sale but customer service is horrendous, and their products seem to fail periodically.

Needed a replacement cable expedited in the middle of a tour due to faulty equipment, and every single rep i spoke to (spoke to about 4) tried passing my issue off to another person in another location, and tell me about different locations they work with that might have said item. No follow up within the company to see if my issue was resolved, just basically left me to figure it out. Found a dead end everytime.

Quality wise they sound ok by themselves, that is until you compare them to the quality of other industry standard ears. The thinness of acs in ears was noticeable instantly.

I’m glad i made the switch and that i won’t have to deal with them again. Save yourself money and if you have to pay a little more with a competitor do so. It will save you in the long run.
